page.title: 07FARMING 3 -SOUTH OF BARRHEAD
page.content: {NETHERTON & DYKE}farms,typical of the area, support {STOCK}as follows:- { {CATTLE}-2{CHAROLAIS BULLS}and 130{COWS all crosses({Hereford, Friesian, {Angus, & Galloway}). Most cattle are inside from Christmas to Easter and are fed on{hay, silage, turnips}and barley. Mothers of{Spring calves}are kept at Netherton (tied up) and mothers of{Autumn calves}are kept at Dyke (loose housing). { {SHEEP}-2{TUPS}(i.e. rams)-1{Leicester} and 1{Suffolk}and 130{crossed {Blackface ewes}are kept on rough grazing all year and produce{2 {lambings}per year. There are also a few other assorted animals- 6{ducks}(1 drake & 4 ducks-{ {Khaki Campbell}and 1{Aylesbury}duck),6 {hens}, 1{goat}and 2{dogs}.
